channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned barriers, 22nd January
item.description:
Barriers have been left outside 17 Ryecroft Road since before Christmas. Please instruct your useless contractor to collect or fine them for flytipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ryecroft Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Lift smells disgusting. People are weeing, 22nd January
item.description:
Non residents are coming to smoke to our building and weeing in the lift

item.title: Skip filled to the brim - never emptied, 22nd January
item.description:
This skip has been outside 26 Lower Clapton Rd and its never emptied. Instead, it creates a public nuisance and health hazard as it attracts animals and off persons digging through. The owner of this property should be found liable.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12” paddling pool size - Growing by the day, 22nd January
item.description:
These pot holes are expanding.. they are leaving gravel chippings all over the road and up to edges of the pavement.. When it rains the pot holes are like paddling pools. Needs fixing ASAP before they become a much bigger job.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 93, Halfway Street, Longlands, Greater London

item.title: Uneven, broken paving slabs outside 40 St Johns Road Sidcup DA14 4HH, 22nd January
item.description:
Have reported this before, but pavements made worse by the bexleyco/skilcrown development of new flats ,entrance in St Johns Road. Developers advised they would replace pavements, but then advised they could locate any "pink" pavements and no o e seems to be taking responsibility for the damage

item.title: At the junction of the underpass and midland road next to the cycle lane, 22nd January
item.description:
There is a neon yellow road bollard here showing a blue circle with a white arrow. This white arrow mistakenly points vehicle drivers into the cycle lane. I think the arrow is supposed to point drivers to the main part of the carriageway instead? I think this needs to be checked.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coach road, Somers Town, Greater London

item.title: High Street SE20 (Penge) on the south side, 22nd January
item.description:
High Street SE20 (Penge) on the south side of street light number 11 (diagonally opposite Mosslea Rd junction) there are three pavement junction boxes – two of which are certainly graffiti tagged – grey one on its end and a green one on its front.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malcolm Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On pavement by entrance to Albert Road, by the side of M&S, next to 'controlled zone' sign on pole, 22nd January
item.description:
Albert Road has not had a road sign for at least half a year now. The road sign to Albert Road was damaged months ago and removed and it (or a replacement sign) is still missing after many months. A new road sign needs to be placed to replace the removed/destroyed one at the entrance to the road, as this is causing some confusion for people trying to navigate. Putting up a sturdier street sign would potentially be sensible if possible.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albert Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: High Street (Penge) SE20 between Anerley Park a, 22nd January
item.description:
High Street (Penge) SE20 between Anerley Park and Thicket Road junction is a brick over bridge – pier for said bridge at street level on north side footpath side graffiti tagged. item.title: Crystal Palace Parade SE19 about ten ya, 22nd January
item.description:

item.title: Pavement destroyed causing pedestrians to pass in the road, 22nd January
item.description:
The pavement outside 47 Birchwood Road is completely destroyed, after an initial visit the area of pavement was cordoned off, around 12th Dec. There has been no return visit to repair the pavement and in the meantime pedestrians are walking in the road to pass. This is near a corner in the road where cars already travel too fast and pedestrians are barely visible in the dark. There will almost certainly be an accident if left for much longer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birchwood Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
